clinical_study.brief_title: Air Barrier System for the Reduction of Airborne Colony Forming Units During Total Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Air Barrier System for the Reduction of Airborne Particulate and Colony Forming Units (CFU) During Total Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: This objective of this study is to determine whether the Air Barrier System device reduces airborne colony-forming units (e.g., bacteria) present at a surgery site during total knee arthroplasty surgeries.

detailed_description.textblock: The Air Barrier System (ABS) is a device that uses localized clean air flow to shield a surgery site from ambient airborne contamination. This study examines the hypothesis that the ABS can reduce the presence of airborne CFU at the surgery site during total knee arthroplasty surgery.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Compare the number of colony-forming units captured at incision sites
primary_outcome.description: A length of tubing will be placed at the incision and will draw air onto agar plates that are changed every ten minutes in both the control and ABS arms.

arm_group.description: In the control arm, the ABS device will be placed as usual on the patient, but the airflow will NOT be activated. Only the technician in the room will be aware whether the device is turned on or not.

In the experimental (intervention) arm, the ABS device will be placed as usual on the patient, and the airflow will be activated. Only the technician in the room will be aware whether the device is turned on or not.

intervention.description: The Air Barrier System is a device that uses localized clean air flow to shield a surgery site from ambient airborne microorganisms that are shed into the air from people present in the operating room.
The Air Barrier System will be deployed onto the surgical field, but the airflow will not be activated, so this is a sham control comparator.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Candidate for total knee arthroplasty
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior history of infection
- Revision surgery
- Screens positive for MRSA
